page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY TOWN HALL
page.content: 6OO yrs ago there was a meat market where the town hall is now.In 1763 Thomas Lord Holmes rebuilt the Town hall.There are some Royal Charters in the upper room.Charles 11 gave us a silver gilt mace because we were loyal to Charles 1. Upstairs there is a meeting room where the town council hold meetings,and they still have meetings there. They used the Town Seal to represent Yarmouth on letters.On St James's Day they stick a pole out of the window with a gloved hand on the end.This prevents you being punished if you drink too much.On Thursdays it is used as a fish market,and it is used by the Womens Institute as a market on Wednesdays in summer.
